question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
How many integers are in the solution set of $|x-2|\leq5.6$ ?
inference:
$$|x-2|\leq5.6$$

$$-5.6\leq x-2\leq5.6$$

$$-3.6\leq x\leq7.6$$

The solution set is the set of all integers between -3 and 7, inclusive. There are 11 integers in this set.

Final Answer: \boxed{11}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Getting rid of the absolute value, we have $-5.6 \le x-2 \le 5.6$, or $-3.6 \le x \le 7.6$. Thus, $x$ can be any integer from -3 to 7, inclusive. There are $7-(-3)+1=\boxed{11}$ integers in this range.
